title: Spicy Thai Noodle Soup With Sliced Aberdeen Angus Steak

ingredients.item: 500ml pack Waitrose Cooks' Ingredients Beef Stock
1 Thai red chilli, deseeded and sliced
2cm piece fresh root ginger, peeled and cut into thin strips
250g piece lean Aberdeen Angus sirloin steak, trimmed of all fat

instructions.step: Place the noodles in a heatproof bowl and cover with boiling water. Leave for 5 minutes then drain. Pour the stock into a saucepan with 300ml cold water. Bring to a boil then add the chilli, ginger and fish sauce. Reduce the heat and simmer gently for 10 minutes, then stir in the lime juice and sugar.  Meanwhile, heat a frying pan until hot, then add the steak and sear for 2-3 minutes on each side. Remove from the pan, cover with foil and leave to rest for 5 minutes.  Divide the noodles between two serving bowls. Thinly slice the steak into strips and arrange on top of the noodles. Stir the coriander into the stock and ladle over the noodles and steak.
